timeline.bodyText: Thinking it might be better to just choose the newest version available and setting that to the default version (in the case that there is at least one left).
timeline.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText:
This is changing from the default always being the most recent to being "sticky".
Thoughts?
timeline.author: denis-yuen

replies.bodyText:
I think the problem was that the user keeps refreshing the entire organization and the UI would change the implicit default version to the most recent one (which they did not want).  This will set the default version to the most recent one once.  If it's the wrong one they can just change it to whatever.
For hosted ones, we also want to avoid changing too often (like if they were doing small modifications for testing purposes)
replies.author: garyluu

replies.bodyText: Agreed, the implicit default version has led to confusion with Terra team.
replies.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText:
Not sure this is the right date to sort on. This is generated by the DB with @UpdateTimestamp
I think this means that it will change when something like frozen is set.
timeline.author: denis-yuen

replies.bodyText: do you think lastBuilt for tags and lastModified for workflowversion is better?
replies.author: garyluu

replies.bodyText: Looking at "Dates/Timestamps in Database for Tools and Workflows" in the shared drive, looks like yes
replies.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText: Can you put the implementation in entry? Looks like the Tool and Workflow implementations are identical.
timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't the filter be !Object.equals(...? You're trying to grab the max date of all versions excluding the version you're about to delete?
timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: Why call this actual default version instead of just default version?
timeline.author: agduncan94

timeline.bodyText:
Removing this might break the CLI. Can you confirm if this is the case or not?
(and how broken or not it is)
timeline.author: denis-yuen

replies.bodyText: CLI and the UI is based on the swagger.yaml . I made sure to not alter it. It seems unlikely to break.
replies.author: garyluu

timeline.bodyText: Javadoc this (looks like a date for the underlying content, whether descriptor files or docker image) and
timeline.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText: I feel like we should give the user with a warning that they're deleting the default version so we're setting the new default to latest. Maybe we should log this message to surface in the UI?
timeline.author: Ldcabansay

timeline.message: Add new column, temporarily add new property
